text: The Enactment of the Great Plan
The Silence of the Southern Seas
Tremors from the Jungle
Across the whole world, a message has been heard. \\n\\n"The Great Plan has been understood. None of you are part of it."\\n\\nThe invasion has begun.
On the dense jungles of Lustria, tremors began. And they haven't stop. Something is happening on Lustria... Prepare for the worst.
Ships sailing through the southern seas are dissapearing without a trace. First tremors, then this... I'm telling you, it's the end of the world.
They're coming!
Increase the port guard, just in case.
After the recent tremors, people has leave the ports in case a giant wave comes...
These dissapearances are driving sailors mad....
Run! Run away from the sea!
Tremors from the Jungle
The Silence of the Southern Seas
The Enactment of the Great Plan
Enactor of the Great Plan
It will enact the Great Plan of the Old Ones. Even if it means to destroy all other races.
Dynamic Disasters
A flexible mod that generates disasters through out the campaign, to make things more interesting.
Enable Dynamic Disasters
Enable/Disable the whole mod. \\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but on-going disasters will still finish.
Enable "Enactment of the Great Plan" disaster

Enable/Disable the "Enactment of the Great Plan" disaster.\\n\\nThe Slann of Lustria have finally understood the Great Plan. And they plan to Enact it.\\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
1.Global Config
2.Disaster Specific Config
Minimum Turn
Difficulty Modifier
Minimum turn required for this disaster to trigger.
Difficulty modifier applied to this disaster.
Enable "A Grudge Too Far" disaster (Vanilla)
Enable/Disable the "A Grudge Too Far" disaster (Vanilla). \\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.

Enable/Disable the "Pyramid of Nagash" disaster (Vanilla). \\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.

Enable/Disable the "Vampire's Rise" disaster (Vanilla). \\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
Enable "Da Biggest Waaagh" disaster (Vanilla)
Enable/Disable the "Da Biggest Waaagh" disaster (Vanilla). \\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
Enable "The Wild Hunt" disaster (Vanilla)

Enable/Disable the "Chaos Invasion" disaster. \\n\\nChaos rises on the north. Daemons roam the land, and corruptions spreads in the wind. Would you be able to turn the tide and save the world?\\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
Enable "Raiding Parties" disaster

Enable/Disable the "Raiding Parties" disaster. \\n\\nThe seas around the world are plagued with Dark Elf Slavers, Norscan Raiders and Vampires from the Deep. Just... don't attract their attention.\\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
Black and Tattered Sails
Black and tattered sails have been spotted on the horizon. We don't know yet where will they attack. Prepare yourself.
Pirates!
Pirates have started raiding the coast of the world. Good luck to the poor devils that atracted their attention...
Beware of the seas.
They're coming!
Enable "Chi'an Chi Assault" disaster

Enable/Disable the "Chi'an Chi Assault" disaster.\\n\\nChi'an Chi is always plotting and scheming beyond the Great Bastion. Make sure the Great Bastion doesn't fall, or we may find out what is he scheming...\\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
Chi'an Chi's gaze is upon them!
Chi'an Chi has send reinforcements!
Chi'an Chi's invasion has begun!
The Great Bastion stands strong!
Chi'an Chi is watching with interest the Great Kurgan horde that approaches the Great Bastion. Why? What twisted scheme is he planning now?
Chi'an Chi has send reinforcements to the Great Kurgan horde attacking the Great Bastion! The bastion must not fall!
The Great Bastion has been breached! Send messengers to all the corners of Grand Cathay! We need to rebuild it soon, or the hordes of Chi'an Chi will flood our lands!
The Great Bastion has resisted the attack and the Chaos Hordes have been repelled... but was this part of Chi'an Chi's plan?
Morrslieb is... growing?
The Under-Empire strikes back!
The Empires under attack!
The Great Lustrian War has begun!
The Karaz Ankor besieged!
Karaz-a-Karak besieged!
Scholars all around the world are perplex. For the first time in recorded history, Morrslieb has grown in size. Nobody knows why.... yet.

As news of hordes of Skaven (they do exists!) running wild over Estalia and Tilea reached us, we found new information: Morrslieb is not bigger, is closer! And it's already affecting the winds of magic all around the world!
The Skaven are a secret no more! Hordes are pouring into the Empire, the northern coast of Arabia, and even the hearthlands of Grand Cathay!
The Great Trans-oceanic Intercontinental Tunnels have been repaired. The Skaven hordes have arrived to Lustria. The Great Lustrian War has begun!
The Karaz Ankor, the great network of dwarven Karaks spanning across the whole old World, is under siege by all sides by hordes of Skaven!
Karaz-a-Karak, the ancestral home of the Dawi, is under siege by hordes and hordes of Skaven! May this be the end of the Dawi?
Enable "The Great Ascendancy (legacy)" disaster

Enable/Disable the "The Great Ascendancy" disaster.\\n\\nThirteen times thirteen passes of the Chaos moon I will give you. Thirteen times thirteen moons I will wait. Go to your legions and your workshops! Bring me victory. Bring me dominance over this mortal realm! You must be as one, work as one, as single-minded as a swarm pouring from a sewer-pipe -- all rats scurry-flood in same direction. Only then will you inherit the ruins of this world, only then will you rule. Thirteen times thirteen moons! Fail, and all will suffer the fate of the seer.\\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
The Vermintide
It comes from the deepest holes of the world, to burn the surface on the name of the Horned Rat.
Morrslieb, The Green Moon, is closer than ever, nobody knows why. But the effects of being so close to that accursed moon are already showing around the world.
The Green Shine of Morrslieb
Skaven corruption: %+n
Possibility of Storms of Magic across the whole world.
The Skaven menace is no more!
Morrslieb recedes!
Morrslieb seems to have gone back to its normal size. It seems we will never know what caused such phenomenom.
After all that destruction, Morrslieb has returned to its natural orbit.
Max Concurrent Endgames
Maximum amount of concurrent endgame disasters that can be run at the same time.
Bless Manaan!
Either by the blessing of Manaan or by sheer luck, a storm unleashed its power upon the Pirate Fleet just as they were prepraring to attack. We can rest... for now.
Enable Debug Mode

Enable/Disable debug mode.\\n\\nIn debug mode, all disasters trigger instantly, and all timers between warnings/phases/invasions/repetitions are reduced to 1 turn. Only affects disasters that support it.
Maximum turn

Maximum turn for this disaster to trigger. If the disaster has not yet triggered when reaching this turn, it'll trigger if none of the requeriments are unfulfilled. \\nSet to 0 to allow the disaster to trigger normally based on its requeriments.
Disable Vanilla Endgames

NOTE: This may cause bugs if switched on and off in the middle of a campaign! And switching vanilla endgames on again requires a save/reload to take full effect. \\n\\nThis setting toggles the vanilla endgame logic on and off. If you uncheck it, vanilla disasters may trigger twice, once by the endgames logic, and once by this mod.
Chaos corruption: %+n
Flow of the Polar Gates
After thousands of years, the Dwarven holds are ready. The long lost holds will be retaken! The book will be empty of Grudges!
The End of an Era
The Dwarfs have declared war onto the whole world! Defeat them and make the incredible famed wealth of the Karaz-Ankor yours!
The Wealth of the Karaz-Ankor
End Times Unfolding
The Chaos Gods have made their move. Now... make yours.
The Slanns of Lustria have finally deciphered the Great Plan of the Old Gods. And you're not on it.
Breaking of the Great Plan
Assault the Black Pyramid!
The Pyramid of Nagash must be taken away from their current occupiers, of the world will be turned into a land of dead.
The Black Pyramid of Nagash has been awaken! Kill the beings performing that horrible ritual before dead covers the world!
The End of the Great Necromancer
Give Rest to the Dead
Death and decay taints the Winds of Magic. Will you leave it stay like that, or will you resist the Tide of Death?
The Greenskin Hordes have assembled the bigger waaaghs ever seen since time immemorial. Would you be able to resist the Green Tide?
The Biggest and Badest Waaagh!
The Hunt for the Wild Hunt
For ages, Orion and his Wild Hunt have terrified the forces of the Old World. It's time the Hunters become the hunted.
Burn the Oak Tree!
And incinerate all that is Amber!
Free Drinks for Everyone!
Seems like thanks to some large shipments of Bugman's Ale, courtesy of a mysterious patron, the Dwarfs have calm down... for now.
The Black Pyramid back to normal
The Black Pyramid seems to have return back to its normal state... for now.
The Black Pyramid back to normal
The Black Pyramid seems to have return back to its normal state... for now.
Vampire's Fall
After an unexpected reduction on the Winds of Magic, it seems the potential vampire thread has been reduced... for now.
Waaagh no more
As fast as it appeared, the Greatest Waaagh has been reduced to nothing. The Greenskins are back to their normal routine... for now.
The Forests Calm Down
The great pressure that came from the Great Forests of the world is gone... for now.
Allucination!
After waiting in fear, it seems those ships of stone were no more than a mere allucination. Trade has resume... for now.
The Great Chaos Invasion of our Age Begins!

The Old World despairs, for Archaon the Everchosen, Champion of Chaos, has come and with him the End Times!\\n\\nOnce a Templar Priest of Sigmar, Archaon uncovered a terrible secret which drove him to reject his faith and pledge himself to the Gods of Chaos. In their service, he has devoted himself to the world’s destruction, defeating all challengers and rising to a position of dominance over all in the Chaos Wastes, achieving the ultimate accolade - his dark coronation as the Everchosen; the vessel through which the Dark Gods unite their followers to turn the world into a Realm of Chaos. It is to his banner that the Warriors of Chaos have been flocking, and it is his malign will that now drives them forth in a terrible wave of destruction destined to sweep all before it.\\n\\nThe earth groans beneath the iron-shod feet of Archaon’s numberless horde, and with him comes death. Is there any champion of the Old World mighty enough to withstand the Lord of the End Times?
The Rise of Chaos

Dire tidings from the North!\\n\\nThe tendrils of Chaos writhe and reach out from the accursed wastes, tainting the land and sowing dissent. Their corrupt forces wax ever stronger, and now their agents are abroad, spreading the foul corruption of their malign Gods.\\n\\nOn their heels come bands of marauding warriors led by the most zealous of the Chaos Lords, eager to wreak destruction in the name of the Ruinous Powers. And all the while, ever more warriors flock to some focal point in the Chaos Wastes, a nexus of power which transcends their petty rivalries and impels them to join with the numberless horde.\\n\\nDoom approaches, and it is only in strength that any hope may be found!
Chaos Stirs

Storm clouds gather in the North. There are rumours that the barbarous tribes residing in the shadow of Chaos have ceased striving against each other for the attention of the Dark Gods and are instead banding together. Suckling at the teat of Chaos, the hordes grow in strength. It seems only a matter of time before the dam breaks and a tide of ruin bursts forth to engulf the Old World, corrupting or destroying all in its path.\\n\\nMarshal your strength, nurture the sinews of war, build your walls high, gather warriors to your banner and temper them in the crucible of battle, so that when the time comes you may yet weather the storm!

The Great Vortex, the vast magical maelstrom at the heart of the island-continent of Ulthuan, has been undone by the forces of Chaos! Without it, rifts to the chaos realms are opening all over the world!
Chaos Receeds
It seems whatever menace was uniting the northern tribes in the chaos wastes it's gone... for now.
An Age of Peace?

As the last of the Chaos hordes is scoured from the face of the world, an awful silence descends. More than a silence; an absence of sound which echoes the all-consuming void without. All creation is stilled, breath held in anticipation of the final cataclysm.\\n\\nThen, tentatively, gently, life reasserts itself. Not in a grand way to echo those who sought to end everything, but in the small ways which of themselves are life. Birdsong pierces the silence, hesitant at first, then swelling; a defiant hymn to creation, borne on a soft wind that sifts dust onto the scattered corpses littering the bloody plain of battle. And the spell is broken. Bloodied veterans, survivors, refugees - all draw breath into their aching lungs and weep at the taste and smell of victory, peace, and life.\\n\\nYet what is life if not the constant striving of one against the other? After all, every hedgerow is a bloody battleground, every plant a murderer, every creature red in tooth and claw. Even as the weak raise their eyes to a golden future, the wise are glancing about to see who will make the first move in seizing it for themselves. The shield of civilisation which turned aside the deadly thrust of Chaos is now a heavy and cumbersome thing. Those who are first to cast it aside will be quickest with their blades, and a knife in the back is surest of all. Comrades who stood shoulder-to-shoulder in the shield wall now step apart and take each other’s measure. Alliances begin to unravel and the storm clouds gather once more.
Enable "Chaos Invasion" disaster
Enable/Disable the "The Wild Hunt" disaster (Vanilla). \\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign, but if you received at least the first warning, the disaster will not stop.
The Great Ascendancy
The Plan of the Skaven has been revealed. For their Great Ascendancy, the world will be turn to ruins! Would you be able to resist the onslaugh?
The Winds of Magic are flowing with an intensity not seen since the last of Ursun Roars.
Rumours say a new Champion of Chaos has appeared, deep in the Chaos Wastes.... Prepare for the worst.
Rumours of a Champion of Chaos
Drums in the Deep
The Dwarfs have begun to assemble their Throng for a war like no other... Prepare for the worst.
The Black Pyramid Trembles
The Black Pyramid has begun to tremble. Prepare for the worst.
Black and Tattered Sails
Black sails have been spotted in the horizon. We don't know their target yet, but... Prepare for the worst.
Secret Schemes
Something is happening on the Under-Empire.... Prepare for the worst.
Death and Decay
Death and Decay covers the land like never before.... Prepare for the worst.
Da Greatest WAAAGH!
The hordes of Greenskins are assembling their Waaaghs.... Prepare for the worst.
The Hunters Prepare...
There is an ominous pressure coming from the Great Forests of the world.... Prepare for the worst.
Enable Chaos Rifts

Enable/Disable the spawning of Chaos Rifts. \\n\\nChaos rifts are required for the later disaster stages, so if you disable them the disaster events will stop at stage two, after spawning all related armies to chaos factions.
A Daemon Prince at sight!

While traversing through the Realms of Chaos, your scouts bring news of a Khornate Horde lead by a Daemon Prince, deep into the Realm of the Blood God. You could ignore it and continue your journey, but... what kind of incredible weapons may this Daemon Prince posess? And are you strong enough to take him down? Whatever you do, remember: nobody comes back the same from a Realm of Chaos, if it even comes back.
Attack the Daemon Prince
Ignore It
A Daemon Prince at sight!

While traversing through the Realms of Chaos, your scouts bring news of a Nurglite Horde lead by a Daemon Prince, deep into the Realm of the Plague Lord. You could ignore it and continue your journey, but... what kind of incredible treasures may this Daemon Prince posess? And are you strong enough to take him down? Whatever you do, remember: nobody comes back the same from a Realm of Chaos, if it even comes back.

Treasures from the Realm of Khorne
Treasures from the Realm of Nurgle
Treasures from the Realm of Slaanesh
Treasures from the Realm of Tzeench
You can find the bloodier weapons in the realm of the Blood God... but everything comes at a price.
You can find the most horrific diseases in the realm of the Plague Lord... but everything comes at a price.
You can find the most pleasant surprises in the realm of the Dark Prince... but everything comes at a price.
You can find the most interesting mysteries in the realm of the Changer of Ways... but everything comes at a price.
The Great Vortex Undone!
The Restoration of the Great Vortex
Without the Great Vortex, daemons of Chaos are free to roam through the whole world! Restore it before it's too late!
The Great Vortex Undone
Without the Great Vortex, there's nothing stopping the daemons of chaos from entering our world.

Enable "Realm Divided" disaster

Enable/Disable the "Realm Divided" disaster.\\n\\nYour uncontrolled expansion within Grand Cathay is unaceptable. By Decree of the Dragon Emperor, you shall surrender your provinces, your armies and your riches to the Emperor. Will you even accept that?\\n\\nSafe to disable mid-campaign as long as it hasn't trigger yet.
A Realm Divided!

A messenger has arrived from Wei-Jin with a message, directly from the Dragon Emperor:\\n\\n"Your uncontrolled expansion within Grand Cathay has gone too far.\\n\\nBy Decree of the Dragon Emperor, your ambitions shall be crushed, your cities returned to the Emperor, and your riches returned to Grand Cathay."\\n\\nAfter deliverating for some time, you give a message back to the messenger:\\n\\n"By My Decree, Grand Cathay must be surrendered to me. It's cities shall be mine, it's riches shall be mine."\\n\\nThe war has begun.
So war it is.
Grand Cathay shall be mine!
And no other shall rule over me!
Submit or Die
My enemies have but one choice: submit to my rule, or die.
The Great Vortex Restored!

It seems someone sane has managed to retake the inner regions of Ulthuan and restore the Vortex! While the chaos invasion is still in full swing, the vortex strength should block any new rifts outside the Chaos Wastes.

After the last battle, whats left of your enemies is in front of you. Their leader, found barely alive a top a pile of corpses, kneels before your blade. But before you cut his head, it speaks: "Forgive my live, and it'll be yours to command". What do you decide? Would you confederate {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}}, or will you end it's life here?
You're forgiven.
The Dragon Emperor is mercyful. I'm not.
The Choice: Servitude or Death
Enable Automatic Difficulty
Enabling this will change the disaster difficulty based on campaign difficulty. This disables the difficulty multipiers of each disaster and the max concurrent disasters selector.
